Pre-Game Insights: India had to face defeat by 5 wickets against South Africa in their last match and is at the number 2 spot in the points table.
Suryakumar Yadav scored 68 runs in this match, but the rest of the team's batsmen galloped early.
Virat Kohli's bat has scored the most runs for the team. Kohli has got 156 runs in 3 matches which include two half-centuries, while Suryakumar Yadav has also scored 134 runs with two fifties.
Opener KL Rahul has been seen in a very poor form which is a topic of concern for the team management and the Indian think tank. Rahul has scored just 22 runs in three matches at an average of 7.33.
Arshdeep Singh has taken seven wickets in the tournament so far and has bowled impressively well.
Bangladesh won the previous match against Zimbabwe by 3 runs where Nazmul Hossain played brilliant innings of 71 runs in this match.
Nazmul Hossain, the hero of the last match, has scored a total of 105 runs in three matches.
The performance of the bowlers of the team has been much better than the batsmen. Taskin Ahmed has so far taken 8 wickets, while other bowlers have also achieved success.
